senses.sense_definition: A direct vote by the eligible voters of a country or region to decide on an important public question, such as a change in the constitution or national independence.

examples.text: The government decided to hold a <w>plebiscite</w> to determine if the region should become independent.
Citizens voted in a national <w>plebiscite</w> to approve the amendments to the constitution.

senses.sense_definition: A law enacted by the common people in ancient Rome, usually without the intervention of the senate.

examples.text: In the early republic, a <w>plebiscite</w> was binding only on the common people, not the patricians.
The tribune proposed a new <w>plebiscite</w> to address the grievances of the lower classes.
